alert.note: Alert for Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 14 at 2:47PM MDT until March 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack in the headwaters of the Virgin River leading to increased snow melt and runoff. Flows in the Subway, the Narrows and other drainages through Zion National Park that feed into the North and East Forks of the Virgin River may increase quickly and reach critical levels within the park. Mainstem river flooding of the Virgin River is not expected. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High flows along the Subway, Narrows, and other drainages within Zion National Park caused by rain and snowmelt are possible. * WHERE...Zion National Park. * WHEN...From 9 PM MDT this evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff will result in high flows on all drainages within Zion National Park. The North Fork of the Virgin River is expect to rise above 3000 CFS, while the East Fork of the Virgin River is expected to rise above 1200 CFS, both of which are below mainstem river flood levels. However flows of these levels will be dangerous to hikers and outdoor recreation within slot canyons and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain combined with mid elevation snow melt in the headwaters of the Virgin River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those with outdoor recreation plans in Zion National Park should be prepared to take action or should flooding develop, or plan to avoid flood prone routes within the park.
